headline: Truist declares common and preferred stock dividends
summary: The Board of Directors of Truist Financial Corporation (NYSE: TFC) declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.52 per common share, payable on March 2, 2026, to shareholders of record at the close of business on February 13, 2026.

raw.headline: Truist declares common and preferred stock dividends
raw.summary: The Board of Directors of Truist Financial Corporation (NYSE: TFC) declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.52 per common share, payable on March 2, 2026, to shareholders of record at the close of business on February 13, 2026.

headline: Stronger Q4 Results And Bigger Buybacks Could Be A Game Changer For Truist Financial (TFC)
summary: In January 2026, Truist Financial reported Q4 2025 results showing higher net interest income of US$3,700 million and net income of US$1,354 million, alongside a completed US$1.25 billion fixed-to-floating senior notes offering and fresh authorization for up to US$10 billion in share repurchases. Beyond the headline earnings beat, Truist’s combination of expanding variable-rate funding, rising earnings per share, and ongoing buybacks signals an intensified focus on balance sheet flexibility...

headline: Why The Narrative Around Truist Financial (TFC) Is Shifting With Fresh Price Target Signals
summary: What a Changing Price Target Really Signals for Truist Financial The recent shift in price target for Truist Financial has put fresh attention on how analysts see the stock today, even though the exact figures behind that change are not specified here. A new target usually reflects updated views on the bank's risk profile, earnings power, and how its business mix stacks up against current expectations, rather than a quick reaction to any single headline. As you read on, you will see how this...
